title: June: Campaign Identity
description: Define your campaign identity through a slogan, mission statement, and announcement speech to guide your campaign messaging.
readingSummary: Your campaign has begun to take shape. You’ve made your first investments, but now you must define who you are as a candidate.
Voters, donors, and the media are asking: 'Why are you running, and why should anyone support you?'
Campaign identity is built on three pillars:
1. Slogan → Short, memorable, and values-driven. Examples: 'A Future We Can Believe In.' or 'Country First.'
2. Mission Statement → One paragraph explaining why you’re running, who you represent, what problem you’ll solve, and why now.
3. Announcement Speech → A brief message to launch your candidacy publicly, including your slogan, top issues, and an authentic, motivating tone.

tasks.prompt: Write your mission statement (1 paragraph), including who you represent, what problem you'll solve, and why now.
Draft your announcement speech (3–5 paragraphs). Include your slogan and highlight your top issues. Ensure it feels authentic and motivating.

purpose: Create a clear campaign identity: slogan, mission, and announcement speech, which will guide all subsequent campaign actions.

scenarios.title: Slogan
scenarios.description: Develop a short, memorable, and values-driven campaign slogan.

scenarios.title: Mission Statement
scenarios.description: Write a focused paragraph explaining your candidacy, who you represent, and the problems you aim to solve.

scenarios.title: Announcement Speech
scenarios.description: Draft a 3–5 paragraph speech that includes your slogan, key issues, and motivates supporters.

outcome.description: AI evaluates user submissions: slogan (+10 signatures), mission statement (+20 signatures), announcement speech (+50 signatures). Total +80 signatures. Updated campaign status includes CC, signatures, and voter approval.

nextModule.title: Campaign Imagery
nextModule.description: Design your campaign’s visual identity, including logos, signs, and shirts. Users will also upload images into the simulator for the first time.
